body: @joaomoreno Can you test this out in raw node.js, I remember node having similar problems before with mounted file systems inside a VM
This does **not** repro in Node. I simply get a `EISDIR` error in vanilla Node 7.4.0.
@joaomoreno are you able to provide the stack trace from the crash?

@kevinsawicki I'm finding it very tough to get a crash report out of it. No crash dumps appear in `TEMP`. When I run `process.crash()` I do get a crash dump in there, though.

I've configured the app to talk to a dummy crash report service.

Here's what `output_log.txt` shows for my crash:

```
[1272:4052:0516/011647.856:VERBOSE1:crash_service_main.cc(78)] Session start. cmdline is [--reporter-url=https://your-domain.com/url-to-submit --application-name=YourName "--crashes-directory=C:\Users\IEUser\AppData\Local\Temp\YourName Crashes" --v=1]
[1272:4052:0516/011647.859:VERBOSE1:crash_service.cc(142)] window handle is 001804AA
[1272:4052:0516/011647.859:VERBOSE1:crash_service.cc(284)] pipe name is \\.\pipe\YourName Crash Service
dumps at C:\Users\IEUser\AppData\Local\Temp\YourName Crashes

maximum 128 reports/day
reporter is electron-crash-service

[1272:3904:0516/011647.865:VERBOSE1:crash_service.cc(317)] client start. pid = 2532
[1272:4084:0516/011654.365:VERBOSE1:crash_service.cc(325)] client end. pid = 2532
[1272:4084:0516/011655.365:VERBOSE1:crash_service.cc(346)] zero clients. exiting
[1272:4052:0516/011655.366:VERBOSE1:crash_service.cc(486)] session ending..
[1272:4052:0516/011655.417:VERBOSE1:crash_service.cc(491)] clients connected :1
clients terminated :1
dumps serviced :0
dumps reported :0
[1272:4052:0516/011655.417:VERBOSE1:crash_service_main.cc(99)] Session end. return code is 0
```
